newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Mine kills Bangladeshi on Burma border.
newsitem.headline: Mine kills Bangladeshi on Burma border.

text.p: A Bangladeshi woodcutter was killed on Thursday by a landmine near the Burmese border, police said.
Police said Nurul Kabir was collecting wood at Walidong hill, 40 km (24 miles) from Cox's Bazar, when the mine exploded.
At least seven Bangladeshis have been killed by mines in the last year.
Bangladeshi security sources said mines had been laid along the border either by Moslem guerrillas to restrict the movement of Burmese troops, or by the troops to prevent cross-border insurgency.
